channel.title: Georgina (Georgy) Falster on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Georgina (Georgy) Falster on My New Hugo Site

item.title: About me
item.description: clouds restore in rain the exhalations of the land and sea -H. W. Longfellow This snippet from Longfellow’s prelude to Michael Angelo describes the water cycle: the movement of water around the Earth. I am a climate scientist, tackling the same topic but using science. I try to understand the huge range of factors influencing when, where, and why rain falls in different places around the world - and how that is changing because of climate change.

item.title: News
item.description: 21 January 2026 New open access paper and datasets! Just published in Hydrology and Earth System Sciences: the stable isotopic composition of monthly precipitation over the Australian continent from 1962-2023, estimated using random forest models. I’m hoping this will be a handy resource for a lot of people working in fields where it is useful to have time-resolved precipitation isotope information - biologists, archaeologists, ecologists, hydrologists, forensic scientists, and of course palaeoclimatologists.

item.title: Research
item.description: Publications on Google Scholar Link to my Google Scholar profile Published Journal Articles Abram, N., N. Maher, S. Perkins-Kirkpatrick, G. Falster, T. Hughes, K. Meissnerm L. Slater, A. King, A. Pitman, G. Moon, W. Morgan. 2025. Quantifying the regional to global climate impacts of individual fossil fuel projects to inform decision-making. npj Climate Action 4: Article 92. Link to publication. Vaiglova, P., H. Kierdorf, C. Witzel, G. Falster, R. Joannes-Boyau, Y.

item.title: CV
item.description: Full curriculum vitae Current Affiliation DECRA Fellow The University of Adelaide Using climate model simulations, rainwater isotopes, weather observations, and tree ring isotopes for a holistic understanding of Australian droughts and how they are changing. Major Extramural Grant Funding L’Oréal-UNESCO For Women in Science Fellowship ($25000, sole investigator) [2025] Australian Research Council Discovery Early Career Researcher Award (DECRA) DE250100071 Quantifying Australia’s long-term risk of rainfall extremes ($438335, sole investigator) [2025] National Computational Infrastructure (NCI) Merit Allocation Scheme The role of Indo-Pacific SST variability in global drought occurrence (1000 kSU, equivalent to $40000, chief investigator) [2025] Previous Affiliations ARC Centre of Excellence for Climate Extremes postdoctoral fellow The Australian National University

item.title: Contact
item.description: Journalists: please see my Scimex profile. Otherwise, my contact details are available from my institutional profile. Here I am with my favourite instrument - the Picarro L2140-i cavity ring-down spectroscopy water isotope analyser.
